full_text:
HOAX: These Mara Ressoto Villa & Spa Jobs are Not Authentic

Paul Tobiko, the Director of Communications at Narok County Government, told PesaCheck that the villa does not exist.

An appointment letter submitted for fact-checking via PesaCheck's WhatsApp Tipline and shared on the Mara Ressoto Villa & Spa website is a HOAX.

Key Findings:

1. Appointment Letter Issues:
- The letter lacks specifics about the job role
- No interview was conducted
- Advises applicants that "the best interview is to see your work"
- Offers a three-month probation period with salary of KSh28,065
- Unusual employment conditions, like restrictions on bringing spouses and children

2. Red Flags:
- Website inconsistently names itself as "Mara Ressoto Villa & Spa" and "Mara Resort & Spa"
- Phone numbers registered under "Mara Resorts", a previously debunked scam
- Same phone numbers used in another fraudulent job ad for "Mara Avillaz Resort and Spa"

3. Verification Checks:
- Not listed among Maasai Mara National Reserve establishments
- Not registered with Kenya's Companies Registry
- Does not exist on Google Maps
- Location links lead to unrelated businesses
- Confirmed non-existent by Narok County Government communications director

Conclusion: The job offer is a HOAX designed to potentially scam job seekers.
title: Azzuri Shelpan Crest Resort is not listed among the resorts that are found in the Mara as seen here: https://www.masaimara.travel/hotels-camps-accommodation.php The resort is not also on Google Maps: https://www.google.com/maps/search/azzurri+shelpan+crest+resort,+Maasai+Mara,+Kenya+/@-1.5106364,35.0901459,12z/data=!3m1!4b1 The resort is not also a registered company: https://brs.ecitizen.go.ke/accounts/32373496/find-business/13?_utf8=%E2%9C%93&application_id=&search%5Btype%5D=company&search%5Bprotect%5D=true&search%5Bq%5D=azzurri+shelpan+crest+resort&submit= A screenshot has been shared on social media showing that applicants are required to pay Ksh2485 for a food handling certificate. This is a red flag as the certificate goes for a lower price and it can be obtained on the county government website. Read the attached article.
vclaim: The Mara Ressoto Villa & Spa job appointment letter circulating online is fraudulent as the establishment does not exist. The purported job offer contains suspicious elements including vague job descriptions, no interview requirements, and unusual employment conditions. The alleged villa and spa cannot be found in official registries, maps, or among legitimate Maasai Mara establishments, and uses phone numbers previously linked to scams.
